summary.para: Provides data for calls to when the feature specified is . Retrieves the list of supported resolutions for the specified codec.

For single GPU operation, set this to zero. If there are multiple GPU nodes, set a bit to identify the node (the device's physical adapter) to which the command queue applies. Each bit in the mask corresponds to a single node. Only 1 bit may be set.
A member of the enumeration specifying the codec for which the supported resolutions are being queried.

The number of resolution ratios to retrieve. This number must match the number in the field returned from a call to with D3D12_FEATURE_VIDEO_ENCODER_OUTPUT_RESOLUTION_RATIOS_COUNT specified as the feature.
Receives a boolean indicating if the query inputs are supported.
Receives the minimum resolution supported for the specified codec.
Receives the maximum resolution supported for the specified codec.
A UINT specifying a number by which the resolution width component must be divisible.
A UINT specifying a number by which the resolution height component must be divisible.

Receives a list of representing the supported resolution ratios for the specified codec as irreducible fractions. The caller must allocate the memory for this array based on the ResolutionRatiosCount field, and assign it to the query struct the call to ID3D12VideoDevice.CheckFeatureSupport.
